title.rendered: Delhi vs Bangalore – Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips, Indian T20 League 2022

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Delhi vs Bangalore Pitch Report

Expect a decent batting wicket at the Wankhede Stadium. Given the shorter boundaries, defending a score could get challenging. Moreover, the dew could also make its presence felt.

Time: Apr 16, 7.30 PM IST

Delhi vs Bangalore Probable Playing XIs

Probable XI for Delhi: Prithvi Shaw, David Warner*, Rishabh Pant (c & wk), Rovman Powell*, Sarfaraz Khan, Lalit Yadav, Axar Patel, Shardul Thakur, Kuldeep Yadav, Mustafizur Rahman*, Khaleel Ahmed

Probable XI for Bangalore: Faf du Plessis* (c), Anuj Rawat, Virat Kohli, Glenn Maxwell*, Dinesh Karthik (wk), Shahbaz Ahmed, Wanindu Hasaranga*, Suyash Prabhudessai, Josh Hazlewood*, Mohammed Siraj, Siddharth Kaul/Harshal Patel

Power Players for Delhi vs Bangalore Match

Kuldeep Yadav is the leading wicket-taker (10) for Delhi in this edition, including a four-wicket haul in the last match against Kolkata. His control despite all the variations has been impeccable. The battle against Glenn Maxwell should be intriguing.

In terms of intent and execution, Dinesh Karthik has been the best batter on show for Bangalore. In five outings, he has only been dismissed once. His boundary-hitting in the final overs has generated plenty of bonus fantasy points.

With consecutive fifties, Prithvi Shaw has been laying a strong foundation at the top for his team. He has scored 165 runs (21 fours and 6 sixes) in four innings at a strike rate of 170.21. The opener also got 48 when he last played against Bangalore in 2021.

Wanindu Hasaranga has been amongst the wickets in every game, owing to which he is the fourth-highest wicket-taker (10) in this edition. His googlies haven’t been easy to pick.

Smart Picks for Delhi vs Bangalore Match

Josh Hazlewood is known for his immaculate line and length, regardless of the format. His disciplined bowling could frustrate and lure the aggressive Delhi openers into playing false strokes.

Khaleel Ahmed performed brilliantly with the ball (3 for 25) in the match against Kolkata. Despite the smaller ground dimensions, he managed to contain the batters and also dismissed the openers cheaply.

After failing in the first game, David Warner responded with a blazing 61 in the last match against Kolkata. Delhi will need more such performances from their premier opener going forward.

Expect nothing but sheer belligerence from Glenn Maxwell. He is not going to allow the opposition spinners to dictate terms. From traditional to unconventional shots, the Australian genius is out there to entertain.

Much of Delhi’s success will depend on how Rishabh Pant goes with the willow. His recent scores read 27, 39*, 43, and 1.

At some point, Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli will have to convert their starts into something substantial. Class players often find ways to break the shackles.

Also read:

Mumbai vs Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) Fantasy cricket Tips

Delhi vs Bangalore Match Preview

Both sides have locked horns 28 times, out of which Bangalore have won 17 and Delhi 10. Bangalore also beat Delhi twice in 2021. As far as current form goes, Bangalore have won three out of five games in the ongoing edition. On the other hand, Delhi have won two and lost as many games.

While Delhi have been struggling with their overseas players, Bangalore appear well placed with the arrival of Maxwell and Hazlewood.
